title: Revisit character set usage (ASCII/Latin1/UTF-8) in description fields

labels.name: E:Desktop Community Admin Improvements
labels.description: Implementation of the needed improvements for the Admin events to be stable.

milestone.description:
**1. Finish anything that wasn't completed in the previous 0.14 cycle**
- And fix bugs as usual. We need to keep tech. debt at a roughly fixed level as we grow out functionality, can't let it accumulate! ;-)

**2. Tokenisation of community ownership**
- Work needed already evaluated in spike.  Community and 'Channel in a Community' URLs don't need to be signed if this will present problems. Patryk to work on this as a continuation of the spike already done.
- See priority 4 below, as this also has some implications for the tokenisation of community work.

**3. Profile showcase backend**
- The long-delayed profile showcase backend!  We have the UI on the desktop ready to go for this feature, and Mobile is going to need the backend for this feature as well, so let's try to get it done in 0.14 [#11081](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11081)

**4. Community tokens visible in wallet when received by user who is not a member of that community**
- Solution obvs. needs to be fully decenteralised and permissionless
- Perhaps whenever a community token is A) sent from a Status Wallet to another user or B) airdropped by a community or C) retailed by a community, a M2M (invisible to the user) Waku message should be sent to the recipient's *ethereum address*?
- This message could either: A) contain the metadata for the token B) tell the user that they have received token, and to check the metadata in either another Waku channel where Control Nodes periodically post Metadata OR check the metadata embedded in the token contract (embedding metadata in the token contract might be a better idea?).  
- The token metadata stored in the token contract is signed by the Community's private key to ensure authenticity.  When the community's private key changes due to ownership of a community being transferred or due to the control node being moved, a transaction must be made to update this metadata so it is signed by the community's new private key.
- See here for how a Waku message can be sent to and Ethereum address https://rfc.vac.dev/spec/20/

**5. Refactor synchronisation of contacts**
- To fix various contact request issues, is a large work item
- Mishka and Igor to work on this?
- https://github.com/status-im/status-go/issues/3720
- https://github.com/status-im/status-go/issues/3803#issuecomment-1654588500

**6. Discord history import into a single channel in an existing community**
- Pay off any Discord history import service tech. debt first
- Then build the import into a single channel functionality, designs for this are already complete

**7. Community chat functionality enhancements**
- Ability to mark a token gated channel as 'hidden', only visible to community members with the requisite tokens



**--- Wallet Team ---**

1. Sending Community created tokens to Status users who are not members of that community
- See priority 4) in the messaging priorities list above.

2. Send NFT functionality

body:
# Bug Report

For various reasons (safety/security/length) we limit our users in what kind of characters they are able to enter in description fields throughout the app (community, group chat, tokens, etc.). We have several regexes for this purpose at the moment:

```qml
    readonly property QtObject regularExpressions: QtObject {
        readonly property var alphanumerical: /^$|^[a-zA-Z0-9]+$/
        readonly property var alphanumericalExpanded: /^$|^[a-zA-Z0-9\-_ ]+$/
        readonly property var alphanumericalWithSpace: /^$|^[a-zA-Z0-9\s]+$/
        readonly property var asciiPrintable:         /^$|^[!-~]+$/
        readonly property var ascii:                  /^$|^[\x00-\x7F]+$/
        readonly property var capitalOnly: /^$|^[A-Z]+$/
        readonly property var numerical: /^$|^[0-9]+$/
    }
```

Clarify/review their usage and possibly be less restrictive for the said "description" fields. The goal is to allow `ascii`, that is 7-bit plain text, w/o control characters (cf https://www.rapidtables.com/code/text/ascii-table.html). Currently is it impossible to enter e.g. any punctuation:

![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/5377645/2d2407c6-a79d-4c47-8974-75b102113563)
Any comments or amendments to this @John-44 @felicio ?

> Any comments or amendments to this @John-44 @felicio ?

The latest info that I got is for the allowed character class to be exactly `[A-Za-z0-9_-.\u0020]`, and that's **both in display names and description**.

I also remember asking for an issue to track implementation of this limitation in https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/6032#issuecomment-1406614163. Please, can I track this then for that reason?

Hi @caybro, I just had a look at the commit closing this issue and wanted to note that while the above mentioned character class was complete, I think it should vary per "use case". Maybe listing it could help:

- Profile display name
    - Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-.\u0020]
    - Exception: The dot only in .eth and if verified
    - Correct: devnull.eth; Dev null; dev-null; etc.
    - Incorrect: devnull.com
- Profile bio
    - Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-.\u0020]
    - Correct: This is Dev Null
    - Incorrect: This is @devnull
- Profile nickname
    - Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-\u0020]
    - Correct: Var Log
    - Incorrect var.log
- Community name
    - Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-\u0020]
    - Correct: My community; My-community_
    - Incorrect: community.eth
- Community description
    - Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-.\u0020]
    - Correct: This is my community.
    - Incorrect: This, is my community
- Channel category name 
    - Chars: [A-Za-z0-9\u0020]
    - Correct: General
    - Incorrect General-1; General.eth
- Channel name
    - Chars: [a-z0-9-]
    - Correct: foo-bar
    - Incorrect: Foo-bar
- Channel description
    - Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-.\u0020]
    - Correct: About this
    - Incorrect: Rules: mention @ here

Also, after seeing some more designs:

- Group chat name
    - Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-,'\u0020]
    - Designs
        - https://www.figma.com/file/7KIYbhoqNGAIFonE0w9TDz/Messages-for-Mobile?type=design&node-id=1801-408488&mode=design&t=To1Af31sPAKyNW5N-4
        - https://www.figma.com/file/7KIYbhoqNGAIFonE0w9TDz/Messages-for-Mobile?type=design&node-id=7026-529039&mode=design&t=To1Af31sPAKyNW5N-4
    - Correct: Dev's meeting; Dev, Null, Var and log
    - Incorrect: Dev+Null

Finally, the "Only letters, numbers, underscores, whitespaces and hyphens allowed" error message would be outdated too.

Cc @John-44 for approval

> 



> Hi @caybro, I just had a look at the commit closing this issue and wanted to note that while the above mentioned character class was complete, I think it should vary per "use case". Maybe listing it could help:
> 
> * Profile display name
>   
>   * Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-.\u0020]
>   * Exception: The dot only in .eth and if verified
>   * Correct: devnull.eth; Dev null; dev-null; etc.
>   * Incorrect: devnull.com
> * Profile bio
>   
>   * Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-.\u0020]
>   * Correct: This is Dev Null
>   * Incorrect: This is @devnull
> * Profile nickname
>   
>   * Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-\u0020]
>   * Correct: Var Log
>   * Incorrect var.log
> * Community name
>   
>   * Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-\u0020]
>   * Correct: My community; My-community_
>   * Incorrect: community.eth
> * Community description
>   
>   * Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-.\u0020]
>   * Correct: This is my community.
>   * Incorrect: This, is my community
> * Channel category name
>   
>   * Chars: [A-Za-z0-9\u0020]
>   * Correct: General
>   * Incorrect General-1; General.eth
> * Channel name
>   
>   * Chars: [a-z0-9-]
>   * Correct: foo-bar
>   * Incorrect: Foo-bar
> * Channel description
>   
>   * Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-.\u0020]
>   * Correct: About this
>   * Incorrect: Rules: mention @ here
> 
> Also, after seeing some more designs:
> 
> * Group chat name
>   
>   * Chars: [A-Za-z0-9_-,'\u0020]
>   * Designs
>     
>     * https://www.figma.com/file/7KIYbhoqNGAIFonE0w9TDz/Messages-for-Mobile?type=design&node-id=1801-408488&mode=design&t=To1Af31sPAKyNW5N-4
>     * https://www.figma.com/file/7KIYbhoqNGAIFonE0w9TDz/Messages-for-Mobile?type=design&node-id=7026-529039&mode=design&t=To1Af31sPAKyNW5N-4
>   * Correct: Dev's meeting; Dev, Null, Var and log
>   * Incorrect: Dev+Null
> 
> Finally, the "Only letters, numbers, underscores, whitespaces and hyphens allowed" error message would be outdated too.
> 
> Cc @John-44 for approval

Great, thanks for the writeup and complete specs :) While we have some additional validators in place already (like for the profile display name not containing `.eth`), many are definitely missing and needs a second round of fixes.

I'll reopen the issue and will have a second look when @John-44 approves

One thing I find odd is that there are different rules for a `channel name` and a `group chat name` (they are effectively the same thing in the UI)
Or that "profile bio" cannot contain e.g. a semicolon (`;`) or a slash (`/`) for citing a website URL?

> I find odd is that there are different rules

Afaik, there aren't any this comprehensive ðŸ™‚. The list above was just my shot at it based on what I've seen, heard or found sensible.
